Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm. Heals the user for ½ its max HP, or ⅔ during a sandstorm. Although this move has great power, it only works the first turn the user is in battle. Can only be used as the first move after the user enters battle. In addition to protecting the user from attacks, this move also poisons any attacker that makes direct contact. Grants the user protection for the rest of the turn and poisons any Pokémon that tries to use a contact move on it. The user attacks while simultaneously stitching the target’s shadow to the ground to prevent the target from escaping. Traps the target. The user swings both arms and hits the target. The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage. Ignores the target's stat modifiers. The user bursts into song, emitting many bubbles. Any Pokémon suffering from a burn will be healed by the touch of these bubbles. Cures the target of burns. The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however. Lowers user's Speed by one stage. The user restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass. Heals the target for ½ its max HP, or ⅔ on Grassy Terrain. The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target’s Attack stat. It also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Heals the user by the target's current Attack stat and lowers the target's Attack by one stage. In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light’s energy, attacking the target on the next turn. Requires a turn to charge before attacking. The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn. Forces the target's opponents to aim at the target for the rest of the turn. The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target’s Speed stat. Poisons the target and lowers its Speed by one stage. The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit. Guarantees a critical hit with the user's next move. The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability. Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage. The user attacks the target’s throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns. Prevents the target from using sound-based moves for two turns. The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that explodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a pollen puff that restores its HP instead. Damages opponents, but heals allies for 50% of their max HP. The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee. Traps the target. This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns. Protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and increases the power of their  Psychic moves by 50%. The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat. Lowers the target's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power. Power is higher the more the user's stats have been raised, to a maximum of 31×. To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type. Removes the user's fire type after inflicting damage. The user exchanges Speed stats with the target. Exchanges the user's Speed with the target's. The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses. Never misses. The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP. Cures the target of a major status ailment and heals the user for 50% of its max HP. The user attacks the target by dancing very hard. The user’s type determines the type of this move. Has the same type as the user. If the Pokémon the user has inflicted damage on have already used their moves, this move eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability. Nullifies the target's ability if it moves earlier. The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again. Forces the target to repeat its last used move. The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it’s heating up its beak results in a burn. Inflicts a burn on any Pokémon that makes contact before the attack. The user rubs the scales on its entire body and makes a huge noise to attack the opposing Pokémon. The user’s Defense stat goes down after the attack. Lowers the user's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light’s energy, attacking the target on the next turn. Requires a turn to charge before attacking. The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn. Forces the target's opponents to aim at the target for the rest of the turn. The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target’s Speed stat. Poisons the target and lowers its Speed by one stage. The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit. Guarantees a critical hit with the user's next move. The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability. Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage. The user attacks the target’s throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns. Prevents the target from using sound-based moves for two turns. The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that explodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a pollen puff that restores its HP instead. Damages opponents, but heals allies for 50% of their max HP. The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee. Traps the target. This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns. Protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and increases the power of their  Psychic moves by 50%. The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat. Lowers the target's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power. Power is higher the more the user's stats have been raised, to a maximum of 31×. To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type. Removes the user's fire type after inflicting damage. The user exchanges Speed stats with the target. Exchanges the user's Speed with the target's. The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses. Never misses. The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP. Cures the target of a major status ailment and heals the user for 50% of its max HP. The user attacks the target by dancing very hard. The user’s type determines the type of this move. Has the same type as the user. If the Pokémon the user has inflicted damage on have already used their moves, this move eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability. Nullifies the target's ability if it moves earlier. The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again. Forces the target to repeat its last used move. The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it’s heating up its beak results in a burn. Inflicts a burn on any Pokémon that makes contact before the attack. The user rubs the scales on its entire body and makes a huge noise to attack the opposing Pokémon. The user’s Defense stat goes down after the attack. Lowers the user's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm. Reduces damage five turns, but must be used during hail. The user, Decidueye, creates countless arrows using its Z-Power and shoots the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user, Incineroar, strengthens its body using its Z-Power and crashes into the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user, Primarina, summons a massive amount of  water using its Z-Power and attacks the target with  full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

The target’s stat changes don’t affect this attack’s damage. Ignores the target's stat modifiers. The user bursts into song, emitting many bubbles. Any Pokémon suffering from a burn will be healed by the touch of these bubbles. Cures the target of burns. The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user’s Speed, however. Lowers user's Speed by one stage. The user restores the target’s HP by up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP when the terrain is grass. Heals the target for ½ its max HP, or ⅔ on Grassy Terrain. The user fiercely attacks the target using its entire body. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target’s Attack stat. It also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Heals the user by the target's current Attack stat and lowers the target's Attack by one stage. In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light and fills a blade with the light’s energy, attacking the target on the next turn. Requires a turn to charge before attacking. The user attacks by pelting the target with leaves. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn. Forces the target's opponents to aim at the target for the rest of the turn. The user shoots poisonous threads to poison the target and lower the target’s Speed stat. Poisons the target and lowers its Speed by one stage. The user concentrates intensely. The attack on the next turn always results in a critical hit. Guarantees a critical hit with the user's next move. The user engages its gears to raise the Attack and Sp. Atk stats of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus Ability. Raises the Attack and Special Attack of all friendly Pokémon with plus or minus by one stage. The user attacks the target’s throat, and the resultant suffering prevents the target from using moves that emit sound for two turns. Prevents the target from using sound-based moves for two turns. The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that explodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a pollen puff that restores its HP instead. Damages opponents, but heals allies for 50% of their max HP. The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee. Traps the target. This protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and powers up Psychic-type moves for five turns. Protects Pokémon on the ground from priority moves and increases the power of their  Psychic moves by 50%. The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user strikes the target with a burning lash. This also lowers the target’s Defense stat. Lowers the target's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user’s stats are raised, the greater the move’s power. Power is higher the more the user's stats have been raised, to a maximum of 31×. To inflict massive damage, the user burns itself out. After using this move, the user will no longer be Fire type. Removes the user's fire type after inflicting damage. The user exchanges Speed stats with the target. Exchanges the user's Speed with the target's. The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses. Never misses. The user heals the target’s status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user’s own HP. Cures the target of a major status ailment and heals the user for 50% of its max HP. The user attacks the target by dancing very hard. The user’s type determines the type of this move. Has the same type as the user. If the Pokémon the user has inflicted damage on have already used their moves, this move eliminates the effect of the target’s Ability. Nullifies the target's ability if it moves earlier. The user lands an intense kick of tropical origins on the target. This also lowers the target’s Attack stat. Lowers the target's Attack by one stage after inflicting damage. The user instructs the target to use the target’s last move again. Forces the target to repeat its last used move. The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it’s heating up its beak results in a burn. Inflicts a burn on any Pokémon that makes contact before the attack. The user rubs the scales on its entire body and makes a huge noise to attack the opposing Pokémon. The user’s Defense stat goes down after the attack. Lowers the user's Defense by one stage after inflicting damage. The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user swings its body around violently to inflict damage on everything in its vicinity. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. This move reduces damage from physical and special moves for five turns. This can be used only in a hailstorm. Reduces damage five turns, but must be used during hail. The user, Decidueye, creates countless arrows using its Z-Power and shoots the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user, Incineroar, strengthens its body using its Z-Power and crashes into the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user, Primarina, summons a massive amount of  water using its Z-Power and attacks the target with  full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. The user, the Land Spirit Pokémon, obtains Alola’s energy using its Z-Power and attacks the target with full force. This reduces the target’s HP greatly. Damages the target for 75% of its remaining HP. After obtaining Z-Power, the user, Marshadow, punches and kicks the target consecutively with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. After obtaining Z-Power, the user, Alolan Raichu, attacks the target with full force. This move leaves the target with paralysis. Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target. Z-Power brings out the true capabilities of the user, Snorlax. The Pokémon moves its enormous body energetically and attacks the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect.

Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. After obtaining Z-Power, the user, Alolan Raichu, attacks the target with full force. This move leaves the target with paralysis. Has a $effect_chance% chance to paralyze the target. Z-Power brings out the true capabilities of the user, Snorlax. The Pokémon moves its enormous body energetically and attacks the target with full force. Inflicts regular damage with no additional effect. After obtaining Z-Power, the user, Eevee, gets energy from its evolved friends and boosts its stats sharply. Raises all of the user's stats by two stages. After obtaining Z-Power, the user, Mew, attacks the target with full force. The terrain will be charged with psychic energy. Changes the terrain to Psychic Terrain after inflicting damage. The user sets a shell trap. If the user is hit by a physical move, the trap will explode and inflict damage on the opposing Pokémon. Only inflicts damage if the user was hit by a physical move this turn.
